Competencies Across the Ciriculum.description: A Competency Across the Curriculum (CAC) course is not a separate course, but rather an overlay that is “double counted” as fulfilling both the CAC requirement and another requirement in either General Education (except for the University Core),the major, or the minor.

courses: A1. Natural Science with Lab (AST, BIO, CHM, ENV, GEL, PHY, or MAR)

B2. Elective (PSY, SOC, CRJ, or SWK)

C3. Elective (PAG, ENG, WRI, HUM, Modern Language (103 or above) or PHI)

Additional Elective Courses.description: 9-18 credits of additional CSC courses, number 300 or above and not previously used for above requirements, excluding any course numbered CSC 87X and CSC 380.
